author: Jess Bengtson
title: Crookston City Council Ways and Means Committee - RV park focus shifts to Central Park
text: • Movie Theatre • Bar/Lounge "All of these amenities would be within walking or biking distance of the park," explained Stassen. "We have a new business in town (Oliver's Canoe Outfitters) that would accommodate canoe rentals and with an added bathhouse (showers), Internet access (wi-fi) and access for the disabled this could really be a good thing for the community." Other additions that could be added to the park if an RV park were to open might include a playground, volleyball court and dog park. The focus on Central Park comes in the wake of an effort last year to put an RV park in Castle Park, a push that triggered a grassroots citizen uprising that eventually led to the council voting against Castle Park as an RV park location. COST A cool $1.5 million is the price range of the proposed RV park before any potential local, state or federal grants are factored in. Stassen's goal is to get the cost below $1 million with grants, if possible, and to finance the total. "We would look at financing for 20 years and possibly subsidize for three years," explained Stassen. "Whatever we make, we can put away for maintenance." Page 2 of 2 - "This could really revitalize our downtown area," he added. Stassen also mentioned that there's a possibility the Red Lake River Corridor Group – which includes Crookston and other communities along the river – may reconvene, and he said that putting forward one application for grant funding for the RV park through the group might help Crookston's chances of receiving funding.
